justification: The authors state that, after the main task, "we administered three additional surveys: Self-Construal scale (Singelis, 1994)…" indicating this scale was used to measure self-construal.
The same sentence lists the "Analysis-Holism scale (Choi et al., 2003)", showing that analytic/holistic thinking style was assessed with this scale.
The authors note administering the "Culture-Free Intelligence test (Cattell, 1940)", identifying it as their measure of non-verbal (fluid) intelligence.
In Experiment 2 they report that "we also obtained participant's responses on the Beck Cognitive Insight Scale (BCIS; Beck et al., 2004)", indicating BCIS was used to quantify cognitive insight.

The paper asks whether heightened post-decision processing is "reflected in increased metacognitive efficiency (meta-d'/d' or Mratio). We estimated metacognitive efficiency…", showing meta-d'/d' served as the metric for this construct.
